bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTH CARE DATA

nplcit.text: Google search, 03/11/2014
Google patents search, 03/11/2014

abstract.p: An apparatus for communicating health care data from a sender to a receiver is provided. The apparatus has a first computer system, a second computer system, and a rules engine. The first computer system has health care data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the health care data from, the first computer system. The rules engine normalizes the extracted health care data to a predefined format.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SISTEMA PARA NORMALIZAR DATOS COMO BASE PARA COMUNICACION ENTRE PARTICIPANTES DEL CUIDADO DE LA SALUD Y ASEGURADORES SOBRE UNA RED DE TRABAJO

abstract.p: Se proporciona un aparato para comunicar datos del cuidado de la salud desde un emisor a un receptor. El aparato tiene un primer sistema computarizado, un segundo sistema computarizado, y un motor de reglas. El primer sistema computarizado tiene datos de cuidado de la salud almacenados en el misma. El segundo sistema computarizado está en comunicacion operable con y se configura para extraer los datos del cuidado de la salud desde el primer sistema computarizado. El motor de reglas normaliza los datos del cuidado de la salud extraídos a un formato predefinido. El motor de reglas define una pluralidad de campos de datos del cuidado de la salud en el formato predefinido, así como una pluralidad de relaciones entre los campos de datos normalizados.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Aparelho para comunicar dados de cuidados com a saúde de um remetente para um receptor, método para comunicar dados de cuidades com a saúde de um sistema de computador para outro, sistemas para trocar dados de cuidados com a saúde entre um remetente e um transmissor, e para normalizar da dos de cuidados com a saúde para transferência entre uma seguradora e um participante

abstract.p: "APARELHO PARA COMUNICAR DADOS DE CUIDADOS COM A SAúDE DE UM REMETENTE PARA UM RECEPTOR, MéTODO PARA COMUNICAR DADOS DE CUIDADOS COM A SAúDE DE UM SISTEMA DE COMPUTADOR PARA OUTRO, SISTEMAS PARA TROCAR DADOS DE CUIDADOS COM A SAúDE ENTRE UM REMETENTE E UM TRANSMISSOR, E PARA NORMALIZAR DADOS DE CUIDADOS COM A SAUDE PARA TRANSFERêNCIA ENTRE UMA SEGURADORA E UM PARTICIPANTE". é provido um aparelho para comunicar dados de cuidados com a saúde de um remetente para um receptor. O aparelho possui um primeiro sistema de computador (10), um segundo sistema de computador e um mecanismo de regras. O primeiro sistema de computador (10) possui dados de cuidados com a saúde armazenados nele. O segundo sistema de computador está em comunicaçao operável com, e é configurado para extrair os dados de cuidados com a saúde do primeiro sistema de computador (10).

O mecanismo de regras normaliza os dados de cuidados com a saúde extraídos para um formato pré-definido. O mecanismo de regras define diversos campos de dados de cuidados com a saúde no formato pré-definido, bem como diversas relações entre campos de dados normalizados.

SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTHCARE DATA

abstract.p: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a system that normalizes healthcare data in various formats and exchange the data between those concerned.

SOLUTION: The system comprises a first computer system 10, a second computer system and a rules engine. The first computer system 10 has healthcare data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the healthcare data from the first computer system 10. The rules engine normalizes the extracted healthcare data to a predefined format. The rules engine defines a plurality of healthcare data fields in the predefined format, as well as a plurality of relationships between fields of normalized data.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: System for communication of health care data

abstract.p: A system for exchanging health care data between a sender and a receiver comprises: a sender computer having health care data stored therein
an intermediary computer in operable communication with and configured to receive extracted health care data from the sender computer and store in a database

a rules engine to normalize the extracted health care data and a receiver computer in operable communication with the intermediary computer and configured to receive the normalized health care data. The rules engine identifies a plurality of health care data fields in a predefined format and defines a corresponding normalized state for data located within the plurality of health care data fields in the predefined format. The rules engine matches health care data fields in the database with corresponding fields of the extracted health care data and enters the extracted health care data into the matching health care data fields in the database. The rules engine also determines the meaning of the extracted health care data located in the matching fields of the database and normalizes the extracted health care data by comparing the meaning of the extracted health care data to the corresponding normalized state for data located in the plurality of health care data fields, and changing the extracted health care data to the corresponding normalized state.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: A data processing system for generating a personal/individual health record of a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor

abstract.p: Disclosed is a data processing system for generating a personal/individual health record of a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor. The system relates to a patient undergoing encounters with a plurality of health care providers regarding a health related issue of the patient, the health care providers requesting payment for at least a portion of the cost for the encounters from the payor. The health care providers submit health related information of the patient to the payor to support the cost of encounters with the patient. The system comprises a personal health record ('PHR') system server which comprises of: a messaging facility
a personal health record population engine
a correlation module

and an access management module. The PHR population engine initially creates a personal individual health record of a patient by storing one or more entries in a personal/individual health record based on encounter data, including at least one of a diagnosis, a treatment, a medication or a procedure of the patient that was exclusively extracted from payor claims data. The access management module supplements existing entries in the personal/individual health record based on input received from at least one of the patient and a health care provider(s) of the patient via the Internet. The correlation module determines a universal health care concept code corresponding to the entries in the health record.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: A method for generating a personal/individual health record of a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor

abstract.p: A method for generating a personal/individual health record of a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor is disclosed. The method comprises a computer performing the steps: of (a) enrolling a patient in a health care plan of a payor, (b) initially establishing a communication link between a personal health record ('PHR') system and the payor, (c) receiving to the PHR system server a payor data element indicative of a health related parameter for the patient from the payor via the communication link, (d) extracting at the PHR system server encounter data comprising at least one of outpatient encounter history, (e) determining at the PHR system server at least one universal health care concept code corresponding to the encounter data

(f) creating at the PHR system server a personal/individual health record of said patient by storing one or more entries into said personal/individual health record based on said encounter data that was extracted from said payor data element and associating the universal health care concept code with each entry
(g) establishing from the PHR system server a communication link with at least one of the health care providers and the patient
(h) supplementing to the PHR system server said personal/individual health record with supplemental data received from the health care providers and the patient

(i) associating at the PHR system server an access list with each user capable of accessing the personal/individual health record, (j) denying at the PHR system server access to a user requesting an entry in the personal/individual health record if the requested entry is in the restricted set of entries
(k) allowing at the PHR system server access to a user requesting an entry in the personal/individual health record if the requested entry is in the accessible set of entries
and Steps (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) occur prior to steps (g) and (h)
the method further comprising associating a first description and a second description with said entry, wherein said first description is synonymous with said second description.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: A method for generating a personal/ individual health record of a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor using a personal health record system server and a personal health record system server

abstract.p: A personal health record ("PHR") system server for use with a patient enrolled in a health plan of a payor is disclosed. The health plan covers at least a portion of the cost of the patient when a patient undergoes encounters with a plurality of health care providers regarding a health related issue of the patient. Under the plan the health care providers request payment for at least a portion of the cost for the encounters from the payor, where the plan requires the health care providers to submit health related information of the patient to the payor to support the cost of encounters with the patient. The PHR system server comprises: a memory for storing instructions and data associated with a personal/individual health record of the patient

and a processor configured to execute the instructions, wherein the instructions cause the processor to perform the steps comprising: (a) transferring payor claims data of the patient to the ("PHR") system server
(b) analyzing the payor claims data to determine which portion of the payor claims data concerning the patient is encounter data comprising one or more of: a diagnosis of the patient
a treatment of the patient
a medication of the patient
a procedure of the patient
a history of office visits of the patient with one or more of the health care providers
or duration of office visits of the patient

(c) populating the personal/individual health record of the patient by storing one or more entries into the personal/individual health record of the patient based on the encounter data, where population of at least a portion of the entries in the personal/individual health record of the patient is encounter data extracted from the payor claims data
(d) organizing the personal/individual health record by associating together one or more entries in the personal/individual health record of the patient that are related
and (e) providing a web-based portal accessible by the patient to view the personal/individual health record of the patient.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: A method for generating a personal/individual health record

abstract.p: A method for generating a personal/individual health record is disclosed. The method comprising a personal health record system server performing the steps: (a) enrolling a patient in a health plan of a payor,
(b) initially establishing a communication link between a personal health record (PHR) system and the payor
(c) receiving payor claims data by the personal health record system server regarding the patient from the payor via the communication link

(d) analyzing at the PHR system server the payor claims data to determine which portion of the payor claims data is encounter data comprising at least one of a diagnosis, a treatment, a medication, a procedure of the patient, a history of office visits with one or more of the health care providers, and duration of office visits
(e) translating at the PHR system server the encounter data into at least one universal health care concept code

(f) creating at the PHR system server a personal/individual health record of the patient by storing one or more entries into the personal/individual health record based on the encounter data and associating the universal health care concept code with each entry

(g) organizing at the PHR system server the personal/individual health record by grouping together entries in the personal/individual health record as related based on the universal health care concept code associated with the entries

(h) subsequent to steps (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f), establishing a communication link between the personal health record system and the patient, wherein the personal/individual health record is viewable by the patient via the communication link

and (i) subsequent to steps (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f), supplementing the personal/individual health record with health-related data regarding the patient from one or more of the health care providers

the method further comprises establishing an access list for a user capable of accessing the personal/individual health record and adjusting the access list based on selections received by the personal health record system from the patient via the Internet

and the method further comprising providing limited access to the personal/individual health record based on a positive identification of a user as a health care provider and preparing an audit record indicative of each data element in the personal/individual health record that the user accesses.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: A method for selectively restricting access to a personal/individual health record

abstract.p: A method for selectively restricting access to a personal/individual health record is disclosed. The method comprises a computer performing the steps: (a) making a personal health record ("PHR") system with a personal/individual health record of a patient accessible at least to the patient and a health care provider of the patient via the Internet, where the personal/individual health record includes a plurality of entries that are associated with at least one universal health care concept code

(b) inserting to the PHR system an entry into the personal/individual health record based on input received by the personal health record system from the patient and from the health care provider via the Internet

(c) associating at the PHR system an access list with each user capable of accessing the personal/individual health record of the patient, where the access list categorizes the personal/individual health record into a restricted set of entries and an accessible set of entries based on the universal health care concept codes associated with entries in the personal/individual health record
(d) denying access at the PHR system to a user requesting an entry in the personal/individual health record if the requested entry is in the restricted set of entries
(e) allowing access at the PHR system to a user requesting an entry in the personal/individual health record if the requested entry is in the accessible set of entries
and (f) adjusting access rights at the PHR system in the access list based on input received by the personal health record system from the patient via the Internet.

abstract.p: An apparatus for communicating health care data from a sender to a receiver is provided. The apparatus has a first computer system, a second computer system, and a rules engine. The first computer system has health care data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the health care data from, the first computer system. The rules engine normalizes the extracted health care data to a predefined format.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Method and System for Generating Personal/Individual Health Records

abstract.p: A system and method for generating and/or updating a personal/individual health record. Inputs of data to the system may come from diverse sources including, but not limited to, patient questionnaires, insurance company (or other payor) claims data, hospitals, clinics and other institutional providers, and individual physicians and physicians' offices.

abstract.p: An apparatus for communicating health care data from a sender to a receiver is provided. The apparatus has a first computer system (10), a second computer system, and a rules engine. The first, computer system (10) has health care data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the health care data from the first computer system (10). abstract.p: A computer system configured to extract and integrate health care data from a plurality of health care payors. The computer system includes a computer configured to communicate with payor computer systems from two or more payors. The computer is also configured to receive health care data of a type related to claims information. A staging database is in communication with the computer and configured to receive the claims information from each of the payor computer systems. The claims information is converted into a normalized format by a normalization system. A rules engine of the normalization system establishes the predefined format, predetermines how each of the plurality of health care data is to appear in its respective field, and remodels any of the health care data that is not expressed as predetermined by the normalized format into the normalized format.
Normalized data expressing information having the same meaning will be expressed in the same format.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTH CARE DATA

abstract.p: A computer system configured to extract and integrate health care data from a plurality of health care payors. The computer system includes a computer configured to communicate with payor computer systems from two or more payors. The computer is also configured to receive health care data of a type related to claims information. A staging database is in communication with the computer and configured to receive the claims information from each of the payor computer systems. The claims information is converted into a normalized format by a normalization system. A rules engine of the normalization system establishes the predefined format, predetermines how each of the plurality of health care data is to appear in its respective field, and remodels any of the health care data that is not expressed as predetermined by the normalized format into the normalized format.
Normalized data expressing information having the same meaning will be expressed in the same format.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTH CARE DATA

abstract.p: A computer system that extracts health care data from one or more health care payors to identify meaningful relationships or patterns in treatments to compare the effectiveness of various treatment of specific diseases is provided. This computer system includes a computer and a staging database. The computer is configured to communicate with one or more payor computer systems of a type that includes one or more databases storing records of the health care data from one or more payors over the Internet. The staging database is in communication with the computer and is configured to receive the health care data from each of the payor computer systems. The health care data from each of the payor computer systems is configured to be converted into a normalized format. The normalized data is the made available to determine comparative effectiveness of various treatments of specific diseases.

abstract.p: A computer system to communicate healthcare data between healthcare participants includes a computer configured to display a personal healthcare record associated with a patient

wherein the personal healthcare record includes normalized data related to the patient and received from a payor computer over the Internet and provider healthcare data related to the patient received from a provider computer over the Internet
wherein the normalized data and the provider healthcare data are of a type that are displayed in separate fields

and wherein the normalized data is in a normalized format of a type that displays healthcare data from one or more sources such that any healthcare data associated with a patient which has the same meaning will be expressed in the same format despite any prior formatting.

abstract.p: A computerized method for facilitating viewing of health records over a communications network. A database is provided on at least one computer having stored electronic health records of a plurality of patients. A request is received via a communications network from a user for access to a selected patient's health record. The user is validated, with the aid of a computer, as to whether the user is authorized to access the selected patient's record. If the user is validated as a health care provider, a first set of available actions are provided. A user that is validated as a patient is provided a second set of available actions.

abstract.p: A system and method for generating and/or updating a personal/individual health record. Inputs of data to the system may come from diverse sources including, but not limited to, patient questionnaires, insurance company (or other payor) claims data, hospitals, clinics and other institutional providers, and individual physicians and physicians' offices.

abstract.p: An apparatus for communicating health care data from a sender to a receiver is provided. The apparatus has a first computer system, a second computer system, and a rules engine. The first computer system has health care data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the health care data from, the first computer system. The rules engine normalizes the extracted health care data to a predefined format. The rules engine defines a plurality of health care data fields in the predefined format, as well as a plurality of relationships between fields of normalized data.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTH CARE DATA

abstract.p: A system for transmitting healthcare data from a provider to one of a plurality of healthcare payors is provided. The system includes a routing system, and routing engine. The routing engine is in communication with at least one provider computer system and a plurality of healthcare payor computer systems. The routing engine is configured to receive uploaded healthcare data from the provider computer system send the data to one of the plurality of healthcare payor computers.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM FOR COMMUNICATION OF HEALTH CARE DATA
SYSTÈME DE COMMUNICATION DE DONNÉES DE SOINS DE SANTÉ

nplcit.text: LEWIS D.: 'Managed-care firm takes lead with diverse extranet' INTERNETWEEK no. 862, 21 May 2001, page 50, XP002971240

abstract.p: An apparatus for communicating health care data from a sender to a receiver is provided. The apparatus has a first computer system (10), a second computer system, and a rules engine. The first computer system (10) has health care data stored therein. The second computer system is in operable communication with, and is configured to extract the health care data from the first computer system (10). The rules engine normalizes the extracted health care data to a predefined format. The rules engine defines a plurality of health care data fields in the predefined format, as well as a plurality of relationships between fields of normalized data.

La présente invention concerne un dispositif servant à la communication de données de soins de santé d'un émetteur à un récepteur. Ce dispositif est constitué d'un premier système informatique (10), d'un second système informatique, et d'un moteur de normalisation. Le premier système informatique (10) sert au stockage de données de soins de santé. Le second système informatique est configuré pour extraire des données de soins de santé du premier système informatique (10) avec lequel il est fonctionnellement en communication. Le moteur de normalisation ramène au format défini les données de soins de santé extraites. Le moteur de normalisation définit dans le format considéré une pluralité de champs de données de soins de santé, ainsi qu'une pluralité de relations entre les champs de données normalisées.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR GENERATING INDIVIDUAL ELECTRONIC MEDICAL RECORD
PROCEDE ET SYSTEME PERMETTANT DE GENERER UN ENREGISTREMENT MEDICAL ELECTRONIQUE

abstract.p: A system (102) and method for generating and/or updating a personal/individual health record. Inputs of data to the system (102) may come from diverse sources including, but not limited to, patient questionnaires, insurance company (or other payor) claims data, hospitals, climes and other institutional providers, and individual physicians and physicians' offices.

La présente invention concerne un système (102) et un procédé permettant de générer et/ou de mettre à jour un enregistrement sanitaire personnel/individuel. Des entrées de données dans le système (102) peuvent arriver de diverses sources., notamment de questionnaires de patients, de compagnies d'assurances (ou d'autres payeurs) de données de réclamation, d'hôpitaux, de cliniques et d'autres fournisseurs institutionnels, de médecins et de cabinets médicaux.
